In no event shall the data authors, CIAT, or relevant funding agencies be liable for any actual, incidental or consequential damages arising from use of the data.

By using the CIAT Dataverse, the user expressly acknowledges that the Data may contain some nonconformities, defects, or errors. No warranty is given that the data will meet the user's needs or expectations or that all nonconformities, defects, or errors can or will be corrected.

The user should always verify actual data; therefore the user bears all responsibility in determining whether the data is fit for the user’s intended use. The user of the data should use the related publications as a baseline for their analysis whenever possible. Doing so will be an added safeguard against misinterpretation of the data. Related publications are listed in the metadata section of the Dataverse study.

fields.value: The Kalkulator: a minimum data tool for rapid ex-ante impact assessment of productivity, nitrogen balance, soil balance, and GHG emissions – Version 1.0.1

authorAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

datasetContactAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

dsDescriptionValue.value: The Kalkulator is a rapid ex-ante impact assessment tool with minimum data requirements that allows users to benchmark and explore multiple environmental impacts of interventions (e.g. productivity-enhancing agricultural practices, soil protection measures) on a farm using four indicators: greenhouse gas emissions, soil nitrogen balance, soil erosion, and on-farm calorie production.

fields.value: Model has been applied in Kenya, Ethiopia, Benin, Burkina Faso, Tanzania, India and Nicaragua

grantNumberAgency.value: CGIAR Research Program on Climate Change, Agriculture and Food Security (CCAFS)
CGIAR Research Program on Livestock and Fish
United States Agency for International Development (USAID)

value:
B.K. Paul, C. Birnholz, J. Koge, S. Fraval, J. MacFadzean, A. Omore, A. Notenbaert (2015). Rapid ex-ante Environmental Impact Assessment of Livestock Intensification Strategies on Mixed Crop-Livestock and Agro-Pastoralist Farmers in Tanga Region, Tanzania. Poster at Tropentag conference. 
http://www.tropentag.de/2015/abstracts/posters/1130.pdf

Notenbaert, A., Van der Hoek, R., Mena, M., Paul, B., Birnholz, C., Mora, A. (2016). Towards sustainable dual-purpose cattle value chains in Nicaragua. Steps to Sustainable Livestock Conference, 12-15 January 2016, Bristol, UK

Van Der Hoek, R., Paul, B.K., Birnholz, C.A., Mena, M., Mora, M.A., Notenbaert, A.M. (2016). Towards the sustainable transformation of cattle value chains in Nicaragua. Oral Presentation, 67th Annual Meeting of the European Federation of Animal Sciences (EAAP), 29 August - 2 September 2016, Belfast, UK. 
http://hdl.handle.net/10568/77236

Birthe K. Paul, Celine Birnholz, Jessica Koge, An Notenbaert, Juliet Braslow, Suvarna Chandrappagari, Biyensa Gurmessa, Špela Kalcic, Rolf Sommer. How climate-smart are the GIZ supported soil protection and rehabilitation technologies in Benin, Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, India and Kenya? Oral presentation at Tropentag, 18-21 September 2016, Vienna, Austria. 
http://hdl.handle.net/10568/77118

Notenbaert A., Lannerstad M., Herrero M., Fraval S., Ran Y., Paul B., Mugatha S., Barron J., Morris J. (2014). A framework for environmental ex-ante impact assessment of livestock value chains, 6th All Africa Conference on Animal Agriculture, Nairobi, Kenya, 26-30 October 2014.

Notenbaert, A.M.O., Dickson, M., Hoek, R. van der and Henriksson, P. 2016. Assessing the environmental impacts of livestock and fish production. Livestock and Fish Brief 16. Nairobi: ILRI. http://hdl.handle.net/10568/78478

Notenbaert, A.M.O., Morris, J., Pfeifer, C., Paul, B., Birnholz, C., Fraval, S., Lannerstad, M., Herrero, M. and Omore, A.O. 2016. Using the CLEANED approach to assess environmental impacts in the dairy value chain in Tanga, Tanzania. Livestock and Fish Brief 21. Nairobi: ILRI. http://hdl.handle.net/10568/78475
